numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice that a person is more likely to get into college if the person is a legacy.
2. This is true no matter how much money the parents of the person make.
3. I notice that the income of the parents of a person can be higher.
4. If the income of the parents of a person is higher then the gap between legacy applicants and non-legacy applicants is larger.
5. I wonder what other factors play the biggest roles in college admission.
6. Test scores are factors in college admission.
7. Grades are factors in college admission.
8. I wonder what other factors play the biggest roles apart from test scores and grades.
9. I wonder why a person in the 85th percentile of income has a low chance of getting into college if the person is not a legacy.
10. This relates to me and my community.
11. Some students in my community compete with legacy students.
12. Some students are not legacy students.
13. Some students need to rely more on grades and achievements to get into college.
14. I want to go to a college.
15. I would not be a legacy at this college.
16. I need to work hard throughout high school.
17. If I work hard throughout high school then I give myself the best chance of getting into this college.
18. The headline is: College is easy to get into if you are a legacy.
